doc:
Diane Ladd https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diane_Ladd 0 Diane Ladd (born November 29, 1935) is an American actress, film director, producer and author. She has appeared in over 120 film and television roles. For the 1974 film Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore, she won the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role and was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. She went on to win the Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress on Television for Alice (1980–81), and to receive Academy Award nominations for Wild at Heart (1990) and Rambling Rose (1991). Her other film appearances include Chinatown (1974), Ghosts of Mississippi (1996), Primary Colors (1998), 28 Days (2000), and American Cowslip (2008). Ladd is the mother of actress Laura Dern, with her ex-husband, actor Bruce Dern. Diane_Ladd ( born November_29_,_1935 ) is an_American_actress , film_director , producer_and_author . She has_appeared in over_120_film_and_television_roles . For the_1974_film Alice Does_n't_Live Here_Anymore , she won the_BAFTA_Award for_Best_Actress in a_Supporting_Role and was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for Best_Supporting_Actress . She went on to_win the_Golden_Globe_Award for Best Supporting_Actress on Television for Alice_(_1980 – 81_) ,_and to_receive Academy_Award_nominations for Wild at Heart_(_1990_)_and_Rambling_Rose_(_1991_) . Her_other_film_appearances include Chinatown_(_1974_) , Ghosts of Mississippi_(_1996_) , Primary_Colors ( 1998_) , 28_Days ( 2000_) , and American_Cowslip_(_2008_) . Ladd is the_mother of actress_Laura_Dern , with her_ex-husband , actor_Bruce_Dern .
